report_title: Industry at a Glance: Pressure Washing Services
executive_summary: The pressure washing service industry has seen growing demand in recent years, with the COVID-19 pandemic having a mixed effect. As more people stayed home, residential demand grew while commercial demand fell. Low interest rates facilitated rising existing home sales and private home improvement spending in 2020-2021, increasing demand. Overall, industry revenue rose at a 0.6% CAGR to reach $1.2 billion in 2024, though profit margins fell amid rising costs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Residential and Nonresidential Markets Show Demand for Pressure Washing
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Providers saw increased 2020-2021 revenue as low rates and more time at home drove residential construction value and home improvement spending, but faced pressure from 2022-2024 as elevated rates disincentivized real estate investment.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The COVID-19 Pandemic Had a Mixed Effect
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic had a mixed effect on the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Improving Demand from the Residential Segment
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite slowing revenue growth, new nonemployer operators should continue entering due to low barriers. Growing corporate profit will drive nonresidential demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry Landscape is Expected to Shift
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry landscape is expected to shift over the coming years.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry offer pressure washing services to buildings and dwellings.

opportunities: High performance driver: Value of residential construction

key_trends: Low barriers to entry, most operators are nonemployers
Pressure washer manufacturers face competition limiting power
Low industry concentration with many nonemployers
In-house and DIY pressure washing are major substitutes
COVID-19 increased residential but decreased commercial demand
Interest rates impact real estate investment and demand
Falling profit amid uncertain operating environment
Rising wage and purchase costs reducing profitability
Residential demand grew as share amid COVID-19
Commercial demand benefited from growing corporate profits

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment accounts for demand for residential pressure washing services. Amid the height of the COVID-19 pandemic, demand for residential pressure washing expanded as more people stayed at home and low interest rates facilitated real estate investments.

This segment accounts for demand for pressure washing services from business firms and farms. Commercial demand for pressure washing dipped as a share of revenue during the COVID-19 pandemic as social distancing and work from home kept people out of commercial spaces.

This segment accounts for revenue from other markets, including local, state and federal governments and not-for-profit organizations. In recent years, other markets have accounted for a relatively stable and small share of revenue for the Pressure Washing Industry in the US.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment accounts for demand for standard pressure washing for commercial real estate. Commercial standard pressure washing faces less competition from do-it-yourself pressure washing as commercial real estate often requires pressure washing on a larger scale. Demand for standard pressure washing for commercial real estate suffered amid the pandemic as commercial real estate generally got less use.

This segment accounts for demand for standard pressure washing for residential real estate. Residential standard pressure washing faces higher competition from do-it-yourself pressure washing than other segments, as standard pressure washing for residential properties is more feasible for homeowners to complete themselves.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Sandblasting and Other Pressuring Washing Services
products_and_services.product_description: Other pressure washing services, including sandblasting, accounts for a small share of demand.

tier_1_suppliers: Home Improvement Stores in the US
Farm, Lawn & Garden Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Power Tools & Other General Purpose Machinery Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The value of residential construction, which includes multifamily structures such as apartment buildings, reflects demand for industry services used for various types of buildings and homes. As the value of residential construction increases, demand for pressure washing services also rises.

This region has a smaller establishment presence.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Main barrier is cost of pressure washing equipment
barriers_points.barrier_description: Most industry operators are nonemployers; the main barrier to entry to the industry is the cost of pressure washing equipment.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Competition from manufacturers limits their power
barriers_points.barrier_description: Pressure washer manufacturers face competition, limiting their power over this industry.

barriers_points.barrier_title: High number of providers and in-house work gives buyers power
barriers_points.barrier_description: The high number of pressure washing service providers and competition from in house work lend buyers power.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Most industry workers are hired to perform manual tasks, such as standard pressure washing, sandblasting and soft pressure washing on residential and non-residential buildings.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs have been volatile in recent years
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases of materials and equipment used to provide industry services comprise a significant portion of industry revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Pressure washing has become more efficient
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Innovations in pressure washing has included becoming more efficient by using less water and using more ecofriendly detergents.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Upstream Residential and Nonresidential Real Estate Markets
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for pressure washing services, which is a part of property maintenance that is often not strictly necessary.

FAQs.question: What is the document about?
FAQs.answer: The document contains industry data such as revenue, number of enterprises, establishments, employment, wages, and value added for a certain industry over the years 2010 to 2021.

FAQs.question: What data is included in the table?
FAQs.answer: The table includes yearly data from 2010 to 2021 on revenue ($ million), enterprises (units), establishments (units), employment (units), wages ($ million), value added ($ million). Data on imports and exports is missing, shown as '-'.

FAQs.question: What is the highest revenue value in the table?
FAQs.answer: The highest revenue value in the table is 1400 ($ million) in 2021.

FAQs.question: What is the lowest number of enterprises in the table?
FAQs.answer: The lowest number of enterprises in the table is 173 (units) in 2010.

FAQs.question: What is the highest employment value in the table?
FAQs.answer: The highest employment value in the table is 483 (units) in 2021.
